intro: Senecio cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
